, "County" is comprised principally of the densely populated Baltimore suburbs, such as

- Downtown Sykesville has a restored African-American schoolhouse. The scenery is pristine. The B&O railroad museum has information on the history of the town and the railroad. The Patapsco river has beautiful scenery.
-  features old homes, and McDaniel college and the Carroll County farm museum, which is dedicated to rural life in the 1800s.

(BWI) is a major point of entry to the region, with the Southwest Airlines hub providing a lot of cheap flights from all over the country.
The big highway running north-south is I-95, which runs up from

, past BWI, through Baltimore, and then up the coast through all the major East Coast cities.

Other important routes include I-70, which goes into Baltimore from
; I-83, which runs north from Baltimore to
; I-97 between Baltimore and Annapolis; and US-50, connecting Annapolis to D.C.
Amtrak is the major operator on the East Coast, and the
, crosses the region, with notable stops
The MARC trains provide a light rail service between D.C. and the
border, passing through the same stations as Amtrak, but with a few more stops, and lower passenger fares.
